The '''Dome of Varda''' was, in a [[Round World version of the Silmarillion|later version]] of the [[legendarium]], a false firmament above [[Valinor]].<ref>{{MR|P5IV}}, p.388</ref> It was made by [[Varda]] to protect the airs of Valinor from [[Morgoth|Melkor]], keeping out his spirits and spies. It was spangled with [[stars]] which were in fact very brilliant sparks. In consequence, the [[sun]]-day was not taken account in the reckoning of time by the [[Eldar]] dwelling in [[Aman]].<ref>{{NM|P1ii}}, p.10</ref> This Dome inspired King [[Thingol]] to build his throne room, called ''[[Menelrond]]''.<ref>{{PM|XII}}, p.371</ref>

== Other names ==
The Dome of Varda was also called "the Great Dome of Valmar" ; or ''Nur-menel'', the lesser firmament, by opposition to ''[[Tarmenel|Tar-menel]]'', the true firmament. 

The expression can be also found in the plural form, as "Domes of Varda",<ref>{{NM|P1x}}, p.71</ref><ref>{{NM|P1xi}}, p.77</ref> but it's not clear what these "domes" mean<ref>http://newboards.theonering.net/forum/gforum/perl/gforum.cgi?post=984434</ref> (possibly a confusion with the "silver domes of Valmar"<ref>{{MR|P2j}}, p.98</ref>).
